speaker: PAGE
text: Come, come. We’ll couch i’ th’ castle ditch till we

speaker: PAGE
text: see the light of our fairies.—Remember, son Slender,

speaker: SLENDER
text: Ay, forsooth, I have spoke with her, and we

speaker: SLENDER
text: have a nayword how to know one another. I come

speaker: SLENDER
text: to her in white and cry “mum,” she cries “budget,”

speaker: SLENDER
text: and by that we know one another.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: That’s good too. But what needs either your

speaker: SHALLOW
text: “mum” or her “budget”? The white will decipher

speaker: SHALLOW
text: her well enough. It hath struck ten o’clock.

speaker: PAGE
text: The night is dark. Light and spirits will become

speaker: PAGE
text: it well. Heaven prosper our sport! No man means

speaker: PAGE
text: evil but the devil, and we shall know him by his
